fields.name: content
fields.description: The content root.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Returns a category or null if the category does not exist. The externalId can either be formatted (e.g commerce://category/categoryId) or plain (e.g. categoryId)

fields.name: commerceBeanByType
fields.description: Returns a commerce bean or null. This is a good call to make when previewing commerce items.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Returns a product or null if the product does not exist. The externalId can either be formatted (e.g commerce://product/productId) or plain (e.g. productId)

fields.name: searchProducts
fields.description: Search for products fulfilling the search parameters. The categoryId can either be formatted (e.g commerce://category/categoryId) or plain (e.g. categoryId)

fields.name: searchProductsFilterByCategorySeoSegment
fields.description: Search for products fulfilling the search parameters.

fields.name: campaignContent
fields.description:
# Find slot definitions managed via campaigns. Only published campaigns are taken into account.
# Parameters:
# - site: the site id
# - channelType: Key used for the template type (e.g. values: "category-page", "content-page", ...). See also query "channelTypes".
# - refinements: Sorted list of refinements (e.g. for a refinement for a category-page: "women-dressed", for a content-page: "82be5043-e2d8-4db4-a6cb-3b58c2213825" (the UUID of a CoreMedia Content)). The refinements are logically linked with or. The most important refinement should be defined first in the array, in case of multiple search hits.

fields.name: previewCampaign
fields.description:
# Preview campaign content for a given campaign id. The campaign doesn't necessarily need to be in state running.
# Parameters:
# - campaignId: the campaign id
# - channelType: Key used for the template type (e.g. values: "category-page", "content-page", ...). See also query "channelTypes".
# - refinements: Sorted list of refinements (e.g. for a refinement for a category-page: "women-dressed", for a content-page: "82be5043-e2d8-4db4-a6cb-3b58c2213825" (the UUID of a CoreMedia Content)). The refinements are logically linked with or. The most important refinement should be defined first in the array, in case of multiple search hits.

fields.name: previewCampaignContent
fields.description:
# Same as campaignContent query, besides published also drafted or paused campaigns are taken into account.
# Parameters:
# - site: the site id
# - channelType: Key used for the template type (e.g. values: "category-page", "content-page", ...). See also query "channelTypes".
# - refinements: Sorted list of refinements (e.g. for a refinement for a category-page: "women-dressed", for a content-page: "82be5043-e2d8-4db4-a6cb-3b58c2213825" (the UUID of a CoreMedia Content)). The refinements are logically linked with or. The most important refinement should be defined first in the array, in case of multiple search hits.
# - previewDate: Sets a simulated date of view for the preview to see how the campaings will look like in tbe future. The format of the string needs to be a valid ISO 8601 DateTime string. In other words, valid datetime strings of the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ are accepted. The time zone offset is compulsory. The time zone offset must either be Z (representing the UTC time zone) or be in the format ±hh:mm:ss.
# - status: List of campaign status to be considered for preview. Allowed values: "DRAFT", "ACTIVE"

fields.name: channelTypes
fields.description: List of channel types for a given site.

fields.name: _service
fields.description: Expose the service description in case you want to use Apollo Federation. See https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/federation-spec

types.name: Banner
types.description: interfaces alphabetically

types.description: types alphabetically

types.name: BigDecimal
types.description: java.math.BigDecimal

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

fields.name: settings
fields.description: Retrieves settings as JSON by a list of list with path segments, e.g. settings(path: [["path1-segment1", "path1-segment2"], ["path2-segment1", "path2-segment2"]]. Supports "\*" as a wildcard to retrieve all settings at once: settings(path: "\*")

types.name: ContentRoot
types.description: The type `ContentRoot` combines access to all content, non commerce related queries.

fields.name: content
fields.description: The `content` query returns any known content object from the content repository by its content `id`.

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>* or its UUID.

args.name: type
args.description: The expected content type, e.g. `CMArticle`.

fields.name: article
fields.description: Dedicated `article` query, returning a content object of type `CMArticle`, matching the given id.

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>* or its UUID.

fields.name: picture
fields.description: Dedicated `picture` query, returning a content object of type `CMPicture`, matching the given id.

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>* or its UUID.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Dedicated `page` query, returning a content object of type `CMChannel`, matching the given id.

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>*  or its UUID.

fields.name: pageByPath
fields.description: The `pageByPath` query with return type `CMChannel` provides access to any page content by its navigation path.

args.name: path
args.description: The navigation path to the requested page. A navigation path is a concatenation of segments, separated by '/'.

fields.name: site
fields.description: Dedicated `site` query, returning a content object of type `Site`, matching the given site id.

args.name: siteId
args.description: The site id of the requested site (of type `String`).

args.name: rootSegment
args.description: The root segment of the requested site (of type `String`).

fields.name: sites
fields.description: The `sites` query delivers an array of type `Site` of all known sites in the content repository w/o any parameter necessary.

fields.name: taxonomy
fields.description: Get taxonomy by id, type match for subtypes

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>*  or its UUID.

fields.name: supportedTaxonomyLocales
fields.description: Returns the list of supported taxonomy locales, configured in the global settings document `TaxonomySettings`.

fields.name: localizedTaxonomy
fields.description: Get the localized taxonomy by id

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>*  or its UUID.

fields.name: taxonomyByPath
fields.description: Get taxonomy by path segments

args.name: pathSegments
args.description: Path segments from root to taxonomy, including the taxonomy value, separated by '/'. Alternatively only the taxonomy value can be provided.

args.name: type
args.description: Type of taxonomy: CMTaxonomy (default) or CMLocTaxonomy. Will be matched exactly.

args.name: siteId
args.description: The site id for taxonomy lookup in the site root folder. If no site id is given, taxonomies retrieved from the global path (/Settings/Taxonomies).

fields.name: search
fields.description: The `search` query provides access to a solr based full text search.

args.name: query
args.description:
The search expression. Supports the operators '+' (mandatory) and '-' (prohibited) to mark terms respectively.
Quotes may be used to combine several words into a phrase, which would otherwise be treated as single terms.
Any odd (unbalanced) number of quotes are treated as non existent!
The wildcard '*' is supported to find partial terms.

args.name: offset
args.description: Offset within the search result.

args.name: limit
args.description: Limits the size of the search result.

args.name: docTypes
args.description:
Content types to restrict the search result to. Misspelled content types are ignored.
When passing an abstract content type along with the parameter `includeSubTypes` = `true`, the subtypes are also retrieved.
The search result does not contain abstract document types.

args.name: sortFields
args.description:
An array of sort fields, concatenated with their sort order by '_', in upper case, e.g. `ID_ASC`.

The possible values are defined in the enum `SortFieldWithOrder`.

Possible sort orders are: `ASC`, `DESC`

args.name: siteId
args.description: The `siteId` can be passed as parameter to restrict search per site.

args.name: includeSubTypes
args.description: Flag to include the sub types of the given doc types in the search. Defaults to `false`.

args.name: customFilterQueries
args.description: List of `FilterQueryArg` input objects: [{key1 : ["value1", "value2", ...]}, {key2: ["value1", "value2", ...]}, ...].

fields.name: facetedSearch
fields.description: A search with facets. Returns all available facets, if no `FacetFilter` are given.

args.name: query
args.description:
The search expression. Supports the operators '+' (mandatory) and '-' (prohibited) to mark terms respectively.
Quotes may be used to combine several words into a phrase, which would otherwise be treated as single terms.
Any odd (unbalanced) number of quotes are treated as non existent!
The wildcard '*' is supported to find partial terms.

args.name: siteId
args.description: The `siteId`. As the facets are configured per site, `siteId` is mandatory.

args.name: facetFilters
args.description:
List of `FacetFilter` input objects: [{facetAlias: "type", filterValues: ["CMArticle"]}, {facetAlias: "subject", filterValues: ["1234", "5678"]}, ...].
If no `FacetFilter` is given, all configured facets are returned.

args.name: facetLimit
args.description: Limits the size of facet values per facet. Defaults to studio config if set or 5 if not.

args.name: offset
args.description: Offset within the search result.

args.name: limit
args.description: Limits the size of the search result.

args.name: sortFields
args.description:
An array of sort fields, concatenated with their sort order by '_', in upper case, e.g. `ID_ASC`.
The possible values are defined in the enum `SortFieldWithOrder`.
Possible sort orders are: `ASC`, `DESC`

args.name: customFilterQueries
args.description:
List of 'FilterQueryArg' objects: [{key1 : ["value1", "value2", ...]}, {key2: ["value1", "value2", ...]}, ...].
FilterQueryArg keys must be provided in the bean 'filterQueryDefinitionMap'.

fields.name: queryList
fields.description: Dedicated `queryList` query, returning a content object of type `CMQueryList`, matching the given id.

args.name: id
args.description: The content id as `integer` or formatted as *coremedia:///cap/content/<id>* or its UUID.

fields.name: suggest
fields.description: The `suggest` query provides access to a solr based suggestions.

args.name: query
args.description: The query expression.

args.name: siteId
args.description: The `siteId` can be passed as parameter to restrict search per site.

args.name: docTypes
args.description: Content types to restrict the search result to. Misspelled content types are ignored.

args.name: includeSubTypes
args.description: Flag to include the sub types of the given doc types in the search. Defaults to `false`.

args.name: customFilterQueries
args.description: List of `FilterQueryArg` input objects: [{key1 : ["value1", "value2", ...]}, {key2: ["value1", "value2", ...]}, ...].

fields.name: detailTextAsTree
fields.deprecationReason: Included in the RichText-Type of the detailText field.

fields.name: detailTextReferencedContent
fields.deprecationReason: Included in the RichText-Type of the detailText field.

types.name: ExtendedTeaserTargetPaginationResult
types.description: Pagination result types

types.name: FacetFilter
types.description: Input type for faceted search requests.

inputFields.name: facetAlias
inputFields.description: An alias name of a configured facet.

inputFields.name: filterValues
inputFields.description: Facet values to be excluded from the facet search result.

inputFields.name: excludeInFacet
inputFields.description: Exclude the filter value clause from facet calculation. Default is `true`.

types.name: FacetedSearchResult
types.description: Result type of the `facetedSearch` query, containing the facets, metadata of the search result set and the result set itself.

types.name: FilterQueryArg
types.description: Input type to include custom dynamic filter queries with a search query.

inputFields.name: EXCLUDE_IDS
inputFields.description: Excludes the given content ids from the search result.

inputFields.name: FRESHNESS
inputFields.description:
A query for content matching a modification date older or newer than the given arguments.

Expects either ["\*", "ISO_ZONED_DATE_TIME"] to match contents older than the given date or
["ISO_ZONED_DATE_TIME", "\*"] to match contents new than the given date.

The date format is expected as `ISO_ZONED_DATE_TIME`, such as `2011-12-03T10:15:30+01:00[Europe/Paris]`.

inputFields.name: TITLE_OR
inputFields.description: A query for the given titles.

inputFields.name: LOC_TAXONOMY_OR
inputFields.description:
Includes only contents matching one of the given location taxonomies.

Takes taxonomy values or complete path segments or taxonomy ids (numeric or content id).
The first element may contain the site id, e.g. "siteId:corporate".
If a siteId is given, the query is site specific, else global.

inputFields.name: SUBJ_TAXONOMY_OR
inputFields.description:
Includes only contents matching one of the given subject taxonoies.

Takes taxonomy values or complete path segments or taxonomy ids (numeric or content id).
The first element may contain the site id, e.g. "siteId:corporate".
If a siteId is given, the query is site specific, else global.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: ImageFormat
types.description: enums alphabetically

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: JSON
types.description: A JSON scalar

types.name: Long
types.description: A 64-bit signed integer

types.name: MapOfString
types.description: Built-in map of scalar type

types.name: PageGrid
types.description: Page Grid

fields.name: placements
fields.description: retrieves the page grid placements as a flat list, optionally filtered by name

types.name: RichTextTree
types.description: Built-in rich text object tree

types.name: SearchResult
types.description: Result type of the `search` query, containing metadata of the search result set and the result set itself.

types.name: Site
types.description: Models the properties of a site object.

types.name: SortFieldWithOrder
types.description: Enum of sort types for the `search` query.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: UUID
types.description: A universally unique identifier compliant UUID Scalar

types.name: ViewTypeHeroPageGridPlacement
types.description: viewtype specific types

types.name: SlotResult
types.description: Result of a campaignContent query.

fields.name: slots
fields.description: List of slots.

types.name: Slot
types.description: The slot data.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of a slot on a page (e.g. "main" or "sidebar").

fields.name: assignment
fields.description: The most relevant assignment for the slot name. If there are multiple assignments from different campaigns for the slot name, the most relevant assignment is the one that has content assigned and is from the campaign with the highest priority. For assignments with the same relevance, the refinement query input is used to determine the most relevant assignment.

fields.name: assignments
fields.description: The list of assignments for the slot name. The limit controls how many assignments are returned. Valid limits are 1 to 10. The assignments are sorted by relevance (see description of the assignment field).

types.name: Assignment
types.description: Named content slot on a page containing a list of content references.

fields.name: campaign
fields.description: The campaign the assignment belongs to.

fields.name: items
fields.description: Content items linked into the slot.

fields.name: refinements
fields.description: All configured Refinements of this Assignment (e.g. refinement: ["women-dressed", "sale"]).

types.name: Campaign
types.description: Holds minimal metadata of the Campaign

fields.name: priority
fields.description: The priority of this slot.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The UUID of the CoreMedia Content (e.g. "82be5043-e2d8-4db4-a6cb-3b58c2213825").

types.name: CampaignStatus
types.description:
# Campaign Status to support status filters in campaign preview.
# - DRAFT: represents Draft, Paused
# - ACTIVE: represents Planned, Running

types.name: _Service
types.description: Service description of a subgraph used by Apollo Federation. See https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/federation-spec

types.name: _Entity
types.description: Support for Apollo Federation. See https://www.apollographql.com/docs/federation/federation-spec

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
